ArticleTitle: Wearables to Understand ECT Duration for Depression

FAQ.q: How long does the effect of ECT last?
FAQ.a: The effects of electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) can vary widely among individuals. Generally, many patients experience relief from symptoms for several weeks to months, but ongoing maintenance treatments may be necessary to sustain benefits. Regular follow-up with a healthcare provider is essential for optimal management.

FAQ.q: Does depression come back after ECT?
FAQ.a: Relapse of depression after electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) can occur, as ECT primarily addresses acute symptoms. Ongoing management, including therapy and medication, may help maintain improvements and reduce the risk of recurrence. Consulting a healthcare provider can provide personalized strategies for long-term wellness.

FAQ.q: How to tell if ECT is working?
FAQ.a: Signs that electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is effective may include improvements in mood, reduced symptoms of depression or anxiety, and enhanced overall functioning. Regular assessments by a healthcare provider can help monitor progress and adjust treatment as necessary for optimal outcomes.

FAQ.q: How many rounds of ECT is normal?
FAQ.a: Typically, patients may undergo 6 to 12 rounds of electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) as part of their treatment plan. The exact number can vary based on individual response and the specific condition being treated, with adjustments made by healthcare providers as necessary.
